channel.title: Can't Connect to Server
channel.description:
I can't seem to get my server online. I can connect with the 127.0.0.1 address and my IPv4 address but I (and others) can't connect with my public IP or No-IP.
I have port forwarded correctly and I allowed the 43594 port to bypass the firewall but I still can't connect.. I haven't worked on a RS private server since 2011, so if I did something wrong I wouldn't be surprised.
What do you think is causing this?

item.title: Can't Connect to Server
item.dc:creator: @runekeepthug runekeepthug
item.description:
@runekeepthug wrote:

If you want me too I’ll Teamview you and see if I can fix it, but that’s up to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Connect to Server
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

deadlyhorror:

Yeah, actually some routers don’t work for some reason, like I had one that didn’t but then I switched and now its fine

I don’t think that’s the case with mine though. I hosted a server back in 2010 with the same router without any problems.

[quote=“Travas, post:6, topic:526959”]Keep in mind that some ISPs will not allow you to open ports at all; and some may only let you open them if you give them a call. Some might actually have you pay extra to do it.[/quote]Hm, this seems likely. I’m going to contact them and ask.

Thanks for the replies.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Connect to Server
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Keep in mind that some ISPs will not allow you to open ports at all; and some may only let you open them if you give them a call. Some might actually have you pay extra to do it.

item.title: Can't Connect to Server
item.dc:creator: @deadlyhorror deadlyhorror
item.description:
@deadlyhorror wrote:

Yeah, actually some routers don’t work for some reason, like I had one that didn’t but then I switched and now its fine

item.title: Can't Connect to Server
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

[quote=“Learning Code, post:2, topic:526959”]Make sure when you portforward, the interal IP (192.168 IP is the machine you’re using) If you have TV I may be able to try and help you out.[/quote]I actually did that already. I’m starting to this is a problem with my net.

[quote=“deadlyhorror, post:3, topic:526959”]run the server and go to canyouseeme.org and check the port 43594, that’ll tell you forsure if you pf’ed correctly. or use a server status checker.[/quote]It says the Connection timed out.

Some guy on Rune-Server checked it out via team viewer and he confirmed that I did port forward correctly, so it must be what I mentioned above.

Read full topic

@deadlyhorror wrote:

run the server and go to canyouseeme.org and check the port 43594, that’ll tell you forsure if you pf’ed correctly. or use a server status checker.

item.description:
@Learning_Code wrote:

Make sure when you portforward, the interal IP (192.168 IP is the machine you’re using) If you have TV I may be able to try and help you out.
